body.p:
I now sit to write to you I hope this will find you in good spirits & well I received your letters & was verryvery glad to get them & always shall be I am well the toe is getting along verryvery fast I ware my boots A little everryevery day I think in A few days I shall be able
to join my regiment I hope so anyway for it is so loansomelonesome here to me I walk around considerable & the more I walk around the more loansomlonesome it is to me the buildings are all burnt & it looks dessolatedesolate but they are repareingrepairing them again Carlisle is miserablermore miserable than Washington for women I think friend waltWalt I should like to Come & see you verryvery much I hope that I shall join my regimintregiment soon & then
shall be near Washington where I Can come & see you
Dear friend I dontdon't now as I have annyany more to write good by & may god bless you
